name: Voices in the Dark: Over Here Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Col. Elizabeth Lockley was dealing with a "supernatural" problem on Babylon 5. How did she handle it?
questions.correct: She summoned a priest from Earth.
options: She asked for help from Pres. Sheridan
The Psi Corps dealt with it.
questions.explanation:
She summoned a priest from Earth.

	Lockley had been a Captain the during the last episode of "Babylon 5" so her introduction as Col. Lockley in this shows a promotion. There was a section of the space station that was seemingly haunted or possessed, so she called in the preacher to help with an exorcism. The priest was of an undisclosed denomination. He was known only as Father Cassidy.

questions.text: What crewman returned from a vacation on Earth and was acting strangely?
questions.explanation:
Simon Burke.

	Burke was a new character for this episode. He was possessed by a demon-like entity of unknown origin. The character was played by Bruce Ramsay.

questions.text: What was the first indication of the problem on Babylon 5?
options: Ghosts appearing in the hallways at random times.
Voices could be heard in the hallways.
questions.explanation:
A smell in Brown Sector.

	Lockley told Father Cassidy that there was a smell in Brown Sector, which was normal for that area, but they couldn't get it to go away. The temperatures in that area were also well below what climate control set for the area.

questions.text: The being inside of the crewmember claimed to be the Devil himself.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When asked if he were the Devil, the creature replied only that he was a humble servant. The creature eventually revealed itself to be known as Asmodeus. He claims to be a member of a race that was bound among the stars by God. Lockley worked through the rest of the episode to prove that wrong.

questions.text: What power or ability did the creature show off to prove he was a supernatural entity?
questions.correct: He made the station, inside and out, erupt in flames.
options: He levitated every object in his cell.
He flew outside of the station without breathing apparatus.
He jumped from one body to another.
questions.explanation:
He made the station, inside and out, erupt in flames.

	Lockley and the priest were talking outside of the cell about how the being hadn't proven it was possession yet, that it could just be a mental illness. That's when the creature used his powers to levitate himself and light everything else on fire. The fire was an illusion though, as nothing was damaged.

questions.text: The creature wanted to be exorcised from the crewman.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He was asking to be stricken from the body from the moment he saw the priest. Lockley and the priest finally figured out that the being was a demon stuck on Earth. It possessed the crewman while he was on vacation and snuck out to the stars on his return trip. However the creature was unable to remove itself from the human host.

questions.text: Col. Lockley consulted with Father Cassidy several times during the episode. Where were those consultations held?
options: Via a medium as Father Cassidy had died
questions.explanation:
In her quarters.

	Father Cassidy was played by Alan Scarfe. Col. Elizabeth Lockley was played by Tracy Scoggins. During the first meeting in her quarters Lockley told the priest she was sorry that her quarters were so small. He responded by saying that most priests had worked in smaller places than her living space.

questions.text: How did Col. Lockley convince the entity in the crewman to go back to Earth?
questions.correct: She sedated him and did it against his will.
options: She told him he could be free, using technology on Earth.
He wasn't sent to Earth, he died during the exorcism.
He wanted to go back there and convinced her to send him back.
questions.explanation:
She sedated him and did it against his will.

	Lockley figured out that the creature had "hitched" a ride to the station in the crewman by checking the ship's log for the ship that Simon had taken back to Babylon 5. She explained how she figured it out to the creature, after he was sedated, and then shipped him back to Earth.

questions.text: Did Pres. Sheridan appear in the episode at all?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The story spans 72-hours, during which Lockley had been waiting for Sheridan to arrive on the station to celebrate the 10 year anniversary of the Interstellar Alliance. While he was mentioned several times, he didn't appear in this half of the "Lost Tales" DVD. The other tale "Over There" featured him as a key player.

questions.text: Who wrote and directed the episode?
questions.explanation:
J. Michael Straczynski

	J. Michael Straczynski was the series creator for "Babylon 5". He also wrote most of the episodes in the original 5-year run of the show, and several of the movies. When the opportunity to add to the franchise came along with the "Lost Tales" segments, he signed on to both write and direct. The other three options never had anything to do with the franchise.
